relations.head: Arsenite
relations.label: upregulate
relations.text: We found that arsenite promoted oxidative stress and YTHDF2 phase separation in a concentration-dependent manner.

relations.head: oxidative stress
relations.label: promote
relations.text: We found that arsenite promoted oxidative stress and YTHDF2 phase separation in a concentration-dependent manner.

relations.head: N-acetylcysteine
relations.label: downregulate
relations.text: In contrast, pretreatment with N-acetylcysteine significantly relieved arsenate-induced oxidative stress and inhibited YTHDF2 phase separation.

relations.head: N-acetylcysteine
relations.label: inhibit
relations.text: In contrast, pretreatment with N-acetylcysteine significantly relieved arsenate-induced oxidative stress and inhibited YTHDF2 phase separation.

relations.head: Arsenite
relations.label: upregulate
relations.text: As one of the key factors to YTHDF2 phase separation, N6-methyladenosine (m6A) levels in human keratinocytes were significantly increased after arsenite exposure.

relations.head: N-acetylcysteine
relations.label: downregulate
relations.text: On the contrary, N-acetylcysteine mitigated the arsenite-induced increase of m6A and m6A methylesterase and the arsenite-induced decrease in m6A demethylase.

relations.head: m6A methylesterase
relations.label: methylate
relations.text: As one of the key factors to YTHDF2 phase separation, N6-methyladenosine (m6A) levels in human keratinocytes were significantly increased after arsenite exposure, accompanied by upregulation of m6A methylesterase levels.

relations.head: m6A demethylase
relations.label: remove
relations.text: As one of the key factors to YTHDF2 phase separation, N6-methyladenosine (m6A) levels in human keratinocytes were significantly increased after arsenite exposure, accompanied by downregulation of m6A demethylases levels.

relations.head: YTH N6-methyladenosine RNA binding protein 2
relations.label: bind
relations.text: Collectively, our study firstly revealed that oxidative stress induced by arsenite plays an important role in YTHDF2 phase separation driven by m6A modification.

analysis:
Context:  
Based on the abstract, the study specifically investigates how arsenite-induced oxidative stress modulates YTHDF2 phase separation. Because arsenite exposure (an environmental toxin) leads to oxidative stress in human keratinocytes, this constitutes a “pathological/environmental stress” context.

Nodes:  
1. Arsenite → chemical compound  
2. N-acetylcysteine → chemical compound  
3. Oxidative stress → biological process/pathway  
4. N6-methyladenosine → epitranscriptomic modification  
5. m6A methylesterase → protein  
6. m6A demethylase → protein  
7. YTH N6-methyladenosine RNA binding protein 2 → gene (following the naming convention in the sample)  
8. YTHDF2 phase separation → biological process/pathway  

Regulatory Relationships (direct statements from the abstract):  
1. Arsenite upregulates oxidative stress.  
2. Oxidative stress promotes YTHDF2 phase separation.  
3. N-acetylcysteine downregulates oxidative stress.  
4. N-acetylcysteine inhibits YTHDF2 phase separation.  
5. Arsenite upregulates N6-methyladenosine.  
6. N-acetylcysteine downregulates N6-methyladenosine.  
7. m6A methylesterase methylates N6-methyladenosine.  
8. m6A demethylase removes N6-methyladenosine.  
9. YTH N6-methyladenosine RNA binding protein 2 binds N6-methyladenosine (meta-relation: promotes YTHDF2 phase separation).
